com.fiu_CaSPR.Frank.Utility

Class MyTimerTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.TimerTask
      • com.fiu_CaSPR.Frank.Utility.MyTimerTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class MyTimerTask
extends java.util.TimerTask
    Created by frankhu on 6/16/15. This timer task begins as soon as the user has finished logging in. Once the user has logged in and we have the Facebook username, It also determines to push the beginning dialog please wait loading. We use this dialog to show that we haven't finished finding the username of the Facebook user which is extremely important. Without the Facebook user's Facebook given username, (which is different from the id and the login username), the entire app does not work correctly and has incorrect results.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        This run thread is constantly ran throughout the app. It detects whether or not the facebook username has been found and if it's on the post or friend request page. It determines this byt seeing if the facebook page url contains soft=composer (for post) and soft=requests (for friend requests)
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Specified by:
        run in class java.util.TimerTask
